attributes.action: Repeal and replace the NFAOP act 1861 with something new and up to date
attributes.background: The best ways in which parliament could update this act is by putting the offences of ABH and GBH in the same act as battery and assault so the law is more concise. In addition to this they could actually define what GBH and ABH is rather than leaving it to the courts to define.
attributes.additional_details: This act is used daily. It is over 150 years old, and lacks key definitions. It is an extremely important act of Parliament, even being considered the workhorse of the legal system by some. The courts themselves have had to define key terms including what constitutes as ABH (Chan Fook) and what constitutes as Wounding (Eisenhower). It shouldn't be left to the courts to decide what Parliament meant when writing the acts as Parliament should have done a good enough job in defining these terms.

attributes.action: Abolish naturalisation fees for any EU migrant who exercises EU treaty rights
attributes.background: Estimated 2.9 million people from EU live in the UK at the moment and contribute to the culture and the economy of UK. It's estimated that "the net fiscal contribution of migrants from the ten central and eastern European countries that joined the EU in 2004 or 2007 was almost £5 billion".
attributes.additional_details: We do contribute to the culture and enrich tradition in this multicultural country. In full respect to the law which allows EU members to stay in the UK, we'd like to ask for the fees to be abolished as a recognition for the contributions we made to the society.

attributes.action: Increase national insurance contributions by £5 a person a month to save the NHS
attributes.background:
The NHS is in crisis. I'm sure most if not everyone would be happy to pay an extra £5 a month in national insurance contributions to help save our special health care system. 
We cannot lose the NHS, or is that what the conservative government want...

attributes.action: Reduce taxes for U30s that earn below £25,000
attributes.background: It is a constant struggle for those who are starting a career , whilst living somewhere where there are a number of career opportunities.  A tax break would help with rents and affordability of life, and reduce debt for those starting off their own life.

attributes.action: Make Personal Finances a core subject in education throughout the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Make personal finance a core subject through educat. This subject would cover interest rates on various bank accounts and the benefits for each. The subject would also inform students the risks of loans and credit cards and the correct way to keep a positive credit score.
attributes.additional_details: Students are leaving school without knowledge on personal finances and how best to manage their funds. General knowledge on council tax, mortgage rates and many more essential finance information is never taught, and therefore left to learn themselves over their young adulthood. Misinformation regarding loans and credit cards can cripple a young adults future credit scores, therefore effecting them for major life decisions.

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds apply for their provisional without having to wait 9 months.
attributes.background: Some teenagers are in stress of having to wait 9 months for a provisional, and I believe that if we lower the age of applying for a provisional, it would really help. Also, if teenagers start driving with experienced drivers at a younger age it would help them drive better in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Also, in emergency cases, if the experienced person is injured or is in need of help the teenager could help by driving to the local hospital or home etc.

attributes.action: Do not bring 3,000 refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background: These children are currently in a safe country, their needs should be met by that country.  It sends out the wrong message and encourages unscrupulous economic migrants/refugees to send unaccompanied and vulnerable children to Europe so they can follow after them.

attributes.action: The establishment of UK legislation protecting Net Neutrality
attributes.background: The free and open internet as it is today has fostered innovation, provided access to information, and facilitated many cultural, economic and political opportunities across this world. It is a driver and tool of innovation, globally and here in the UK. And should be protected so it is not lost.
attributes.additional_details: With the Great Repeal Bill coming forward, we have concerns over the potential loss of protection to Net Neutrality. While the Broadcasters Stakeholders Group has a Code of Practise, this is a voluntary measure and if the UK was to open up contracts to global companies for future trade deals, this measure may not be enough to safeguard Net Neutrality here in Britain. We want the government to take early action and also establish the UK as a global leader in safeguarding a free and open internet.

attributes.action: Stop sanctions for Jobseekers of 4 weeks or more
attributes.background: People would have no money for food, heating, electricity, clothes and toiletries and risk becoming homeless.  The claimant commitments are too unrealistic and not everyone has access to computers for Universal jobmatch every day or skills needed.
attributes.additional_details:
JSA is only £72 per week and some people must pay Council tax and housing out of this.
Job centre work coaches are getting stressed about issue as they are on the front line and must implement this cruel sanctioning.  Some leave due to a conscience.

attributes.action: Parental responsibility should be transferred to the parent who has residency.
attributes.background: Currently the law indicates that Parental Responsibility is those who have legal rights and responsibilities for the child's upbringing, who can make decisions regarding schooling, name changes etc. I want the government to debate if the law should be amended in the cases where a parent wants no
attributes.additional_details: further contact with a child and cases of harm to the child, for the responsibility and decision making to be transferred over to the remaining parent. My sons father is unable to see his son due to the CAFCASS report and he also informed court he wants no further contact. I have changed my sons surname by Deedpoll but passport etc needs authorisation and permission from the father, even in these circumstances when all evidence shown. These rights should be abolished.

attributes.action: Free childcare hour from their 3rd birthday
attributes.background:
In Scotland children from their 3rd birthday get their free hours of child care but in England we have to wait until the next term.
I would like every child on their 3rd birthday to get their free hours

attributes.action: Introduce a new 'National Health Tax' which is only to be used for NHS.
attributes.background: Most people in the UK seem to be happy with paying extra to fund the NHS. An new NHT would target funds directly to where they are needed and not form part of a central pot. NHT could be applied to the following: Petrol and diesel, Alcohol, tobacco, UK visitors at port of entry (£25.00) etc
attributes.additional_details:
NHT would be in addition to VAT but NOT be applied to direct income.
For example current VAT at 20% could be raised to 21% to include 1% NHT. The government could no longer be blamed for not having enough cash as the NHT would be a disclosed figure and allocated directly. We should also reduce grants to the FA and other organisations not in need and reduce overseas aid. This saving can be converted as an NHT income.

attributes.action: NHS to revert back to using bank nurses and stop using agency nurses.
attributes.background: I am informed by my local MP Rt Hon David Evennett MP that the NHS saved £600 million in the first year of reducing using agency staff.  Obviously to stop this use would be a worthwhile saving particular as the NHS needs the money urgently now.

attributes.action: I'd like to see the NHS running the National Lottery and keeping all profits.
attributes.background:
We are losing the NHS, it needs emergency care immediately.
Lets start with the obvious and put in a line. We do have one available.
That infusion can come from the National Lottery.

attributes.action: Amend the Aggravated Murder of and  Violence against Women Bill to include men
attributes.background: The Bill had its first reading in Parliament on the 31st January 2017. The obvious thing that was picked up by one member of parliament, that being Philip Davies, was that he recognised that the bill was sexist. How it got approved is beyond comprehension.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cats except from registered breeders.
attributes.background: The stray cat population is out of control. Sale of cats should be restricted to registered breeders who neuter and meet animal welfare standards.

attributes.action: UK should allocate more of its aid and development money to endangered species
attributes.background:
A proviso should be added to the aid and development money that we provide to Africa, that some of the money must to go towards endangered species.
Hopefully if the UK put aside more funds for endangered species, the African governments will also make a change.

attributes.action: Negotiate freedom of movement with Canada after Britain leaves the EU.
attributes.background: Both Great Britain and Canada would be greatly benefited by having freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Build A Road Link From Great Britain To Northern Ireland
attributes.background:
I'd like to see a road link be built with either a bridge or tunnel from the mainland (Great Britain), to Northern Ireland.
Not only would this connect the whole of the UK, but I belive would benefit trade between the home nations.
All of a sudden, Northern Ireland would be much more accessible.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-23672538

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=/amp/www.scotsman.com/business/companies/could-a-bridge-or-tunnel-one-day-link-scotland-with-ireland-1-4130353/amp&ved=0ahUKEwiQpvja_fTRAhUrBcAKHUxXA0UQFggpMAE&usg=AFQjCNFu7YCXfYxhQLc5wcsOrzUFPaKjRA&sig2=_FE223uc_ZiJK6gyYXPuMA

http://www.railforums.co.uk/showthread.php?t=35376

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Irish_Sea_fixed_crossing

attributes.action: Greater punishment for drivers convicted of drug or alcohol offences
attributes.background: Laws already allow for higher alcohol consumption in the UK than in many other countries and yet we allow offenders to face very limited actions or penalties for what is a serious offence. Repeat offenders see no consequence for their actions regardless of if they injure or kill anyone.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014 for example between 220 and 260 people were killed in Great Britain where at least 1 driver was over the drink drive limit
The total number of casualties of all types in drink drive accidents is 8,210. 
2015 show there were between 200 and 290 deaths in drink drive accidents AN INCREASE ON THE PREVIOUS YEAR

attributes.action: Introduce free drug purity test kits into Pharmacies across Britain.
attributes.background: Too many young individuals are taking drugs that in most cases are not what they are said to be, leading to cases of serious harm and often death. Drug consumption is not something that can be stopped, but can be made safer with the introduction of these purity testing kits that could save lifes.

attributes.action: Make all drinks producers  replace plastic containers with glass bottles.
attributes.background: Many years ago,all drinks were sold in glass bottles with very little effect on the environment,unlike the plastic containers which are causing serious pollution,especially in seas and oceans.
attributes.additional_details: A deposit scheme could be introduced to ensure most bottles were returned for re-cycling.

attributes.action: Give new and expectant mothers 6 months to pursue discrimination claims.
attributes.background: Mothers are being let down.The Equality and Human Rights Commission reported that 77% of women had experienced discrimination in the workplace due to pregnancy or maternity. However, a restrictive time-limit of 3 months is one of the reasons less than 1% of these are pursued to Tribunal. #GiveMeSix
attributes.additional_details:
Pregnancy and maternity discrimination is subtle by nature. For new and expectant mothers, dealing with this can be overwhelming. Many women won’t have the strength to tackle the issue immediately. Attempting to deal with this could put the health of the mother and unborn child at risk.

A 6 month time-limit would give mothers that little bit of breathing space. Help us reach 100,000 signatures so the 54,000 women a year who lose their jobs for being pregnant have greater access to justice.

attributes.action: Ban Employers from rejecting applicants without giving feedback.
attributes.background: I woulf like to see the government prevent Employers rejecting candidates particularly after and interview without giving feedback on where sed candidate went wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
"Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful"  Thank you for taking part in the recent assessment for the position of Online Driver.

While you demonstrated some of the skills we’re looking for, after careful consideration we regret to inform you that you have been unsuccessful Something like this isnt helpful.

attributes.action: Set a goal of landing a person on the Moon by 2050.
attributes.background: A lot of people feel that the United Kingdom no longer has a sense of unity or direction in the wake of the EU referendum. Setting this goal would bring it back, as well as boosting industry and encouraging skilled workers to remain in the UK. It would also help our position as part of ESA.
attributes.additional_details: Only a few countries in the world are capable of launching humans into space and sadly neither the UK nor any member states of the European Space Agency have this capability. By setting this goal we will send a clear message to the world that we are still looking to be at the for front of technical innovation and achievement. It will also raise public awareness of the UK's satellite industry and encourage more people to get involved in science and technology.

attributes.action: Declare smoking in public areas a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is a choice and no-one should be punished for the choices of another. Smoking should be made illegal in public areas to assist non-smokers who do not wish to be in contact with the toxic fumes of second-hand smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone's needed to walk past someone smoking in public and needing to hold their breath to avoid inhaling the toxic fumes. Every year, second-hand smoke kills thousands of people in the UK from lung cancer, heart disease, strokes and the lung disease COPD. Second-hand smoke has been linked to around 165,000 new cases of disease among children in the UK each year. Passive smoking may also increase the risk of cancers of the larynx and pharynx.

attributes.action: Make Queen's birthday a national holiday
attributes.background: Make the Queen's birthday (the 21st of April) a UK wide public holiday.

attributes.action: Postpone Brexit by a year until we find out how US will be under new president
attributes.background: The USA president has issued several executive orders some of which are in contravention of international norms. There could be repercussions internationally and until we know the long term outcome we should not trigger Brexit just now which would mean reliance on an unstable trading partner of USA.
attributes.additional_details: Trump has issued many executive orders already, one of which is in contravention of the Geneva Convention on refugees. In retaliation at the ban on nationals from seven Muslim countries, Iran and Iraq are already discussing banning US nationals. This could produce further instability in an the Middle East. It would be naive of the UK to exit the single market and rely on trade with a country that not only disregards international norms but could alienate our other trading partners. Wait a year.

attributes.action: Reinstate Functional Skills as an alternative for Level 3 EYE's
attributes.background: I am concerned that in 2014, the government altered the requirements for those taking Level 3 in EYE and now, all Level 3 EYE's must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths to count in the ratios - with equitable alternatives such as Functional Skills no longer considered as an option.
attributes.additional_details: Potential new recruits, who have all the skills, including good English and maths, to be excellent Early Years Educators, will be barred from the sector. Its only a matter of time before we do not have the practitioners to fill the much needed roles which will have catastrophic impact on the Early Years sector, and in turn on parents and children. 30 hours free Child care is on its way.

attributes.action: Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies.
attributes.background:
Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies and Bailffs.
If anyone in the UK has or is experiencing any kind of financial difficulties then passing the debt to any Debt collection agency or Bailffs incur extra cost to which adds extra stress and anxiety.

attributes.action: Debate possibility that the "Peoples Will" has changed since Scotland Referendum
attributes.background:
In 2014 the Scottish public voted to Remain a part of the UK and it is increasingly evident that the full implications were not considered regarding Remain in the run-up to the referendum. 

Numerous polls suggest there would now be a clear majority to Leave.
attributes.additional_details: Any such debate should be before any Brexit implications debate as this referendum was in 2014 and the EU Leave/Remain vote was in 2016.

attributes.action: Offer more funds to councils to fix the roads
attributes.background: I have had 3 tyre punctures on my car due to the road surface being really bad.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in Oxford are pretty bad, council is not fixing them due to lack of funds.

attributes.action: This nation should prohibit extradition of people to the USA.
attributes.background: The USA has a president who advocates torture and the USA practices imprisonment without trial at Guantanamo Bay. Both these are abhorent to any civilised society.

attributes.action: Recall the UK ambassador to the USA in protest against the travel ban
attributes.background: On 27 January 2017, the U.S. President signed an executive order banning all entry of people from seven muslim-majority countries. This includes refugees, holders of visas and green cards, and current. U.S. residents. The UK should officially recall its ambassador to the US in protest.
attributes.additional_details: The executive order signed by U.S. President Donald Trump and its consequences have been widely covered in the press. Many people currently travelling but living in the USA are suddenly separated from their loved ones, including refugees. The order is officially motivated by "anti-terrorism" but does not make anybody safer anywhere, no national from any listed country has commited terrorism on US soil. The UK must send the clearest possible signal of disapproval by recalling the US ambassador.

attributes.action: Bring back EMA money allowance for college students.
attributes.background: College students in need of money in order to support themselves instead of living off the bare minimum.

attributes.action: Referendum for England & Wales to leave the UK if we don't leave the EU & Laws
attributes.background: It was clear in the referendum that the free movement of Labour was one of the main reasons people voted to leave the EU. We do not want to be bound by the EU or any of its laws and this includes the single market and especially free movement of people. IF Scotland can push for this then so can I/we
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the refruredum leave campaign about controlling immigration, via using a different system and taking back control of our laws.

attributes.action: Bring democracy to the workplace
attributes.background: Many of us today take great pride having democracy in politics, but one place we have never tried to implement democracy, the place we spend most of our adult life, is the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, I ask for this petition to include workers in each workplace to have the right to,

form a union

elect and deselect members of management

have a say on wages and hours

have a say on how the workplace is run and how the profits are used

allowed to have a weekly/monthly meeting to discuss and vote on anything the workers feel are necessary for the workplace

attributes.action: Have a cross party panel run the nhs rather than the government.
attributes.background: A cross party panel could make long term decisions for the nhs rather than the government making short term decisions based on their political ideology, popularity and what will keep the government in power.

attributes.action: Make 'having somewhere to call home’ affordable again.
attributes.background: Too many people in our country can no longer afford to live comfortably and without unreasonable stress. This is already a crisis and must be addressed NOW.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose the following as a ’starting place’:
- UK house prices should rise in line with the average UK individual wage; regulation should be in place to prevent prices rising in line with what people can borrow.
- Regulation should be in place to ensure that UK average monthly rent for any domestic property does not exceed UK average monthly mortgage payments made by home-owners in similar properties.
- Banks should be heavily taxed for every non-repayment mortgage they issue.

attributes.action: Make driving lessons a part of the education system for 16-18 year olds
attributes.background: making driving a part of the education system could potentially lower the amount of car accidents on the roads involving young people. many people have an accident in their first year of driving, teaching young people about the dangers of driving at a younger age could prevent this.

attributes.action:
Make July 1st Diana Princess of Wales Day
.....a National Bank Holiday....
attributes.background: 20 years ago we lost this amazing woman and what better tribute to her than making her birthday, July 1st, a national bank holiday to celebrate her life and the joy she brought to millions in this country and around the world......

attributes.action: Introduce 2 part practical driving test, with the inclusion of a motorway test.
attributes.background:
Motorists lack of knowledge of the Highway Code is creating a culture of dangerous driving, which is likely to be the cause of many accidents.

I would like to see the current driving test revised to introduce a new 
2nd part that tests a motorists practical competence of motorway driving.
attributes.additional_details:
A learner driver is prohibited from using a motorway, and their first use of a motorway will only be after they have passed their driving test. Drivers need to be tested on their practical competence and application of the rules before being allowed on motorways alone. 

On a daily basis I witness motorist's breaching rules 264, 267 & 268 of the Highway Code which cover lane discipline and overtaking. DoT report of road traffic accidents shows an increase of people killed or seriously injured.

attributes.action: The Government immediately brings the Crime and Courts Act 2013 s.40 into force.
attributes.background: Parliament enacted s.40(6) “This section does not apply until such time as a body is first recognised as an approved regulator”. IMPRESS is an approved regulator. Secretaries of State say, ‘The time is not yet right’. Further consultation defies the will of Parliament: an abuse of government power.
attributes.additional_details:
If a TV/radio programme treats you unfairly and/or unwarrantably infringes your privacy, you have a right to complain to the independent Ofcom.  The Press should also be accountable without costs risk to the complainant: but they continue to complain and lobby!
See: IMPRESS http://tinyurl.com/zcy5q36
HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/jag72kt for positive views and rebuttal of Press claims and the merits of IPSO.
Voices of victims  HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/j7wuvgk and http://tinyurl.com/zxhvrr3

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the West Midlands Ambulance base at Aston Fire Station!
attributes.background: The West Midlands Ambulance Services central base is at the Aston Fire Station. Due to the Council saying they are no longer able to fund this they are planning to close the base unless they can raise £50,000! This would make Northfield and Erdington the next closest ambulance bases.
attributes.additional_details:
Anybody who has needed an Ambulance in an emergency for themselves or loved ones will know that minutes really matter, in a situation that requires immediate treatment those minutes really are the difference between life and death. The extra few miles these crews would have to travel will be costing vital seconds, even those of you outside Birmingham know the importance of the emergency services and their ability to respond quickly. Please sign and share, Thankyou
http://www.wmas.nhs.uk/about-us

attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid £810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: Ban disturbing photo's on new tobacco packaging
attributes.background:
Ban disturbing photos on new tobacco packaging

New tobacco packaging law became introduced to the UK in May 2016 which concluded that blank packaging would be made for all tobacco products. New photographic images are also in place with new packaging which are incredibly disturbing to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
One packaging strikes myself which is incredibly appalling to be advertised is the packaging 'Smoking kills your unborn child' with a shocking image of a baby coffin with grieving parents looking over the cot. This image is absurd to anyone who may be going through miscarriage/loss child who DO NOT even smoke. 

Ban these shocking images, blank packaging is reasonable without going over the top.

attributes.action: Provide more help for young people trying to start up their own business.
attributes.background: Early stages of my teen life I was on the roads. However due to participating in some workshops provided by my local youth club it opened up doors for me. After a while I started looking at the big picture and saw my actual potential and decided to start up my own brand. We need more of this.
attributes.additional_details: Young people in today's generation are stereotyped to be thugs, thiefs & bad. These kids face a significant amount of gateways into that lifestyles, but where is the gateway to the successful lifestyle? We make it so easy for our kids to join the roads but so difficult to become a business person.

attributes.action: Require companies to give paid & undisclosed leave for Dysmenorrhea(period pain)
attributes.background: The higher the amount 'ill' days an employee or a prospective employee has can negatively affect employment. Symptoms are directly related to being a women. Some would say women need to be able to take days off every month without any record of them not working that day and to be paid in full.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/mar/02/uk-company-introduce-period-policy-female-staff
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38207846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37438767
http://zodiakmalawi.com/component/k2/why-every-woman-should-be-offered-menstrual-leave
http://www.nhs.uk/conditions/Periods-painful/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Add Sports to the school curriculum
attributes.background: Our nation is known to celebrate sporting achievements in football, golf, rugby, olympics etc. But schools do not support them. We should have sports as part of the subjects chosen in secondary school. This way students who excel at physical activities are able to gain scholarships for their gifts

attributes.action: Increase the age to play the lottery from 16 to 18 the same as other gambling.
attributes.background: I have seen how gambling affects people. A 16 year old could buy a ticket and win millions. This could be dangerous, it could cause them to go off the rails.They could get in with the wrong crowd and be led into a life of drink and drugs.  This amount of money should be with adult supervision.
attributes.additional_details: You have to be 18 to gamble in this country, for example fruit machines, betting shops and casinos. Why is the lottery any different?
